poem:
The Lord's Whisper  

In the halls of quiet power,  
a whisper, a nudge, a stirring breeze—  
golden stakes in shadowed games,  
in strident silence, pocketed pleas.  
Old rules bend, with doubled creases,  
lobby hidden behind velvet doors,  
while armies march on distant shores.  
Silence now; pen this dissent anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ex-army chief Lord Dannatt lobbied ministers for millions to support commercial deal A member of the House of Lords lobbied the government to get financial support worth millions of pounds for a commercial deal he was steering, documents reveal. It is the second time that Richard Dannatt, a former head of the British army, has potentially broken parliamentary rules that forbid lobbying. He is under investigation by the House of Lords authorities over a separate". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
